td.p: Study for Quizlet Questions on Photosynthesis

tr.td: Continuation of Life of Plants film

td.p: Watch THIS 13 minute Calvin Cycle overview on Khan Academy. He also summarizes the light dependent reaction (not that his diagram is flipped with the inner thylakoid at bottom).
You are welcome to take notes if you wish and it's easy because he writes down everything for you!
If interested, HERE is the link to the Calvin Cycle as it is understood with all of the enzymes and intermediate molecules. The beginning summary should be familiar to you all after our studies.

td.p: Reading from page 22 to 26 from ONLINE TEXTBOOK on Important Biological Molecules and Movement of Substances within Body Fluids.
1. Describe in simple terms the chemical nature of sugars, proteins, lipids, nucleotides and enzymes.
2. Discuss the biological importance of each of these important groups of molecules.

p.span: ompare and contrast the processes of osmosis and diffusion
4. Describe how molecules move within and between body compartments.

entry.title: Life Systems Assignments due 9/9 and Beyond

td.font: Revisit Gall Fly lab investigation with introduction to Statistical Analysis
Data Handling and Analysis Packet: Activity 320 (Manipulating Raw Data) and 321 (Planning a Quantitative Investigation)

tr.td:
Independent Investigation Background and Research Question Development
(2-3 paragraphs of information based on your online research into topics of interest) Keep in mind that your work must be within the scope of our school resources and safety standards.
Set up/Preliminary testing of research question

td.p: Cell Biology Packet questions

td.font:
Review Termite HW Questions (see prior posting for questions)
Data Handling and Analysis
Mystery Object Assignment (link HERE and below)

Mystery Object Activity
Handout/Link: Asteroids and Dinosaurs
Read Asteroids and Dinosaurs article and answer questions:

b.span: What questions did the researcher or researchers focus on?
What parts of the scientific process did the scientists use to learn more about their questions? Be specific.
Explain what some of the major clues were that scientists used to study the connection between asteroids and dinosaurs.
How did technology improve the researcher’s ability to gain answers to their questions?
What other questions do you have about this topic having read the article?

span.font: Manipulating Raw Data and Planning a Quantitative Investigation

font.span: and answer the following questions from the reading:

div.font:
Questions on the Reading:
1. Describe the ways in which the formation of the gall benefits the gall fly larva.

2. Female gall flies are very selective about where they lay their eggs, laying only on Solidago
altissima even though other, closely related species of goldenrod may grow nearby. How does the
fly know the proper plant on which to lay her eggs?

3. It is advantageous for the female Eurytoma gigantaea to place their female offspring on larger
galls. How do wasps determine which offspring will be female and which male? Can mammals
determine the sex of their offspring? Why or why not?

td.font:
- Course Introduction and discussion of the research process
- Inquiry Activity: Characteristics of Life

b.span: Answer pages 434 (The Scientific Method) and 435 (Variables and Data) of the handout on Data Handling and Analysis.

font.font:
- Characteristics of Life
- Lecture Outline HERE

td.font:
Watch THIS Lab Safety Video.
Review and sign Lab Safety Contract

- Continued Safety Overview
- Termite Inquiry Lab

span.font: Explain the social structure of termite colonies and how this is connected to the behavior that you observed in the lab
Do all termites within a colony have similar physical characteristics? If not, how are they different?

font.span: From an evolutionary perspective, how can you explain the loss of a particular sense such as sight?
font.b: For this question, please use only preexisting knowledge… I am not looking for a right or wrong answer.
